interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Butt Naked Baby Organic Sunshine Lotion | Everyday Moisturizer | Lightweight, Non-Greasy | Normal-to-Dry Skin | Aloe, Shea Butter, Sunflower Oil, Calendula, White Tea, Green Tea, Rooibos Tea, Lemon Oil | 6.7 oz
Review Date: 2020/11/17
Store: Butt Naked Baby
Average Rating: 3.6
Product Details: {'Brand': 'Butt Naked Baby', 'Item Form': 'Cream', 'Active Ingredients': 'Vitamin_e', 'Unit Count': '6.7 Fl Oz', 'Number of Items': '1', 'Package Dimensions': '7.52 x 2.24 x 2.09 inches; 7.8 Ounces'}
Review Text: I really wanted to like this. The name, packaging and labeling is cute. “The 91%” organic label on the front was odd, yet reassuring that they are a transparent and honest brand (I mean, where else have you seen such a random percentage?) Yet, when I smelled it, I did not like it. At all. I can’t describe it really; it’s a faint, cheap perfumey sunflower smell. I didn’t like it for our toddler and couldn’t even tolerate it for me. I wouldn’t say I’m really that picky of a person, but I just didn’t jive with the smell. I even offered it to my husband because he likes organic lotions for the back of his arms where he has some KP but even he didn’t like it! I guess in a pinch we could use it, but it will not be preferred over other scents.
Review Title: The packaging is cute, the smell is not
Rating: 2.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
No Brainer Gentle Facial Cleanser, 6 fl. oz, For Dry & Sensitive Skin, Leaves Skin Feeling Clean, Soft and Hydrated, Hydrolyzed Rice Protein & Amino Acids Restores Skin by Higher Education Skincare
Higher Education
{'Item Form': 'Liquid', 'Skin Type': 'Sensitive', 'Brand': 'Higher Education', 'Age Range (Description)': 'Adult', 'Unit Count': '6.00 Fl Oz', 'Package Dimensions': '7.2 x 2.3 x 2.3 inches; 8.01 Ounces', 'UPC': '811381030056'}
I like the smell of this and how light it is. It does kinda feel like jelly and doesn’t lather up super great for me, but it gets the job done and makes my face feel good. Haven’t broken out or had irritated skin from it. The smell is light and reminds me of something I can’t put my finger on...maybe light citrus candy or something? It smells pretty good to me and I enjoy washing with this in the shower. Good size too!
A pleasant, non-irritating face wash
Study Buddy Clay Mask with Detoxifying Bentonite, 3 fl. oz., Exfoliates, Brightens and Clears Pores, Clay Draws Out Impurities and Improves Skin's Texture and Tone by Higher Education Skincare
Higher Education
{'Brand': 'Higher Education', 'Item Form': 'Clay', 'Product Benefits': 'Exfoliating', 'Scent': 'Exfoliating', 'Skin Type': 'All', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Package Dimensions': '5.6 x 3.6 x 1.3 inches; 5.61 Ounces', 'UPC': '811381035006'}
I love a good face mask - this hits all the marks for me. It is thick and basically feels like wet pottery in your hands (hence the clay), smells nice (somewhat perfume-y) and most importantly, feels like something I’d get at a spa. When I first put it on, I was surprised by the warming sensation, since I didn’t realize it had that effect. I liked it! I’ve had masks like that before and they just add another dimension to the experience. I left it on for 10 minutes and washed it right off. Some clay masks I’ve used are hard to wash off - not this one. Face felt smooth and had no irritation afterward. I really like this brand.
Warming sensation is so good
Butt Naked Baby Organic Sunshine Lotion | Everyday Moisturizer | Lightweight, Non-Greasy | Normal-to-Dry Skin | Aloe, Shea Butter, Sunflower Oil, Calendula, White Tea, Green Tea, Rooibos Tea, Lemon Oil | 6.7 oz
Butt Naked Baby

I really wanted to like this. The name, packaging and labeling is cute. “The 91%” organic label on the front was odd, yet reassuring that they are a transparent and honest brand (I mean, where else have you seen such a random percentage?) Yet, when I smelled it, I did not like it. At all. I can’t describe it really; it’s a faint, cheap perfumey sunflower smell. I didn’t like it for our toddler and couldn’t even tolerate it for me. I wouldn’t say I’m really that picky of a person, but I just didn’t jive with the smell. I even offered it to my husband because he likes organic lotions for the back of his arms where he has some KP but even he didn’t like it! I guess in a pinch we could use it, but it will not be preferred over other scents.
The packaging is cute, the smell is not
profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Skin Concern:** Prefers products suitable for dry and sensitive skin, emphasizing non-irritating formulations.
- **Product Functionality:** Values gentle, effective cleansing that maintains skin hydration without causing breakouts or irritation. Recently appreciated a clay mask that detoxifies and improves skin texture, indicating openness to gentle exfoliating products.
- **Scent Preference:** Enjoys light, pleasant scents, particularly citrus or sweet notes, but may be sensitive to certain fragrances. A recent negative experience with an organic lotion's scent highlights the importance of enjoyable, non-perfumy fragrances in product choices.
- **Texture Preference:** Favors lightweight textures while enjoying thick, clay-like textures in masks, suggesting an appreciation for diverse formulations that enhance sensory experiences.
- **Usage Context:** Integrates skincare routines into daily activities like showering, seeking convenient, easy-to-use products while valuing indulgent treatments that enhance self-care moments.
- **Purchase Consideration:** Evaluates products based on a balance of quality performance and pleasurable sensory experience, with a clear inclination towards pampering experiences and effective results without irritation. Recent feedback indicates the need for scent preferences to align with enjoyable and luxurious experiences.

Overall, the user maintains a clear inclination towards gentleness and sensory pleasure in effective skincare solutions while emphasizing the importance of fragrance in their product selection.
